items.title: Poll: Netanyahu coalition would gain only 51 of 120 seats in case of elections
items.summary: Opposition parties would win 69 seats if an election were held on the day the poll was conducted, while Likud remains the largest party with 25 projected seats. Far-right Religious Zionism party would win four seats, after previously failing to clear the electoral threshold

The All-Russian Cossack Society turns school clubs into pipelines for state-sponsored militarisation and recruitment for war in Ukraine. Bellingcat shows how they shape an alternative mobilisation force.

items.title: Over a quarter of Israelis consider emigrating, new poll finds
items.summary: Slightly more Arab Israelis than Jewish Israelis are inclined to leave, with top reasons for departure among both groups 'lack of a good future', rising costs of living, and the security situation. Almost two-thirds of both groups also cited the government's judicial overhaul as a central concern
